intro: Urostachya celebica, commonly known as the Celebes panicgrass, is a species of flowering plant native to the Indonesian island of Sulawesi. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, wiry stems. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny flowers, typical of grasses. It is often found in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and forest edges. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
